description.en: A legal document giving official permission to do something with a resource.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A legal document giving official permission to do something with a resource.

description.en: The corresponding licence in the NAL licence.

usage.en:
This property supports the assessment of the reuse conditions of the licence. 

This property is mandatory in case the licence document is not a member of the NAL licence.

rawTags.definition-en: The corresponding licence in the NAL licence.

description.en: A type of licence, e.g. indicating public domain or royalties required.

description.en: A standard or other specification to which a Dataset or Distribution conforms.

description.en: A literal value such as a string or integer; Literals may be typed, e.g. as a date according to xsd:date. Literals that contain human-readable text have an optional language tag as defined by BCP 4715.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A literal value such as a string or integer; Literals may be typed, e.g. as a date according to xsd:date. Literals that contain human-readable text have an optional language tag as defined by BCP 4715.

description.en: Anything described by RDF.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: Anything described by RDF.

description.en: A preferred label of the category.

usage.en: This property can be repeated for parallel language versions of the label.

rawTags.ap-defintion-en: This property contains a preferred label of the category. This property can be repeated for parallel language versions of the label.
rawTags.ap-definition-en: A preferred label of the category.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: This property can be repeated for parallel language versions of the label.

description.en: A description following the vCard specification, e.g. to provide telephone number and e-mail address for a contact point.

usage.en: Note that the class Kind is the parent class for the four explicit types of vCards (Individual, Organization, Location, Group).

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A description following the vCard specification, e.g. to provide telephone number and e-mail address for a contact point.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: Note that the class Kind is the parent class for the four explicit types of vCards (Individual, Organization, Location, Group).

description.en: A webpage that either allows to make contact (i.e. a webform) or the information contains how to get into contact.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A webpage that either allows to make contact (i.e. a webform) or the information contains how to get into contact.

description.en: A email address via which contact can be made.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A email address via which contact can be made.

description.en: An identifier in a particular context, consisting of the string that is the identifier; an optional identifier for the identifier scheme; an optional identifier for the version of the identifier scheme; an optional identifier for the agency that manages t

description.en: A catalogue or repository that hosts the Datasets or Data Services being described.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A catalogue or repository that hosts the Datasets or Data Services being described.

description.en: A site or end-point (Data Service) that is listed in the Catalogue.

usage.en: As empty Catalogues are usually indications of problems, this property should be combined with the previous property dataset to implement an empty Catalogue check.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A site or end-point (Data Service) that is listed in the Catalogue.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: As empty Catalogues are usually indications of problems, this property should be combined with the previous property dataset to implement an empty Catalogue check.

description.en: A Catalogue Record that is part of the Catalogue

description.en: A Dataset that is part of the Catalogue.

usage.en: As empty Catalogues are usually indications of problems, this property should be combined with the next property service to implement an empty Catalogue check.

rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: As empty Catalogues are usually indications of problems, this property should be combined with the next property service to implement an empty Catalogue check.

description.en: An entity (organisation) responsible for making the Catalogue available.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: An entity (organisation) responsible for making the Catalogue available.

description.en: A licence under which the Catalogue can be used or reused.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A licence under which the Catalogue can be used or reused.

description.en: A description of a Datasets entry in the Catalogue.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A description of a Datasets entry in the Catalogue.

description.en: A link to the Dataset, Data service or Catalog described in the record.

usage.en: A catalogue record will refer to one entity in a catalogue. This can be either a Dataset or a Data Service. To ensure an unambigous reading of the cardinality the range is set to Catalogued Resource. However it is not the intend with this range to require the explicit use of the class Catalogued Record. As abstract class, an subclass should be used.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A link to the Dataset, Data service or Catalog described in the record.

description.en: A collection of operations that provides access to one or more datasets or data processing functions.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A collection of operations that provides access to one or more datasets or data processing functions.

description.en: This property refers to a collection of data that this data service can distribute.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: This property refers to a collection of data that this data service can distribute.

usage.en: The landingpage provides information about the Data Services performance, capacity and availability.

rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: The landingpage provides information about the Data Services performance, capacity and availability.

description.en: The root location or primary endpoint of the service (an IRI).

rawTags.ap-definition-en: The root location or primary endpoint of the service (an IRI).

description.en: A description of the services available via the end-points, including their operations, parameters etc.

usage.en: The property gives specific details of the actual endpoint instances, while dct:conformsTo is used to indicate the general standard or specification that the endpoints implement.

rawTags.ap-definition-en: A description of the services available via the end-points, including their operations, parameters etc.
rawTags.ap-usageNote-en: The property gives specific details of the actual endpoint instances, while dct:conformsTo is used to indicate the general standard or specification that the endpoints implement.

description.en: A name given to the Data Service.

usage.en: This property can be repeated for parallel language versions of the name.

description.en: Information that indicates whether the Dataset is open data, has access restrictions or is not public.

description.en: A physical embodiment of the Dataset in a particular format.

usage.en: This is a distribution that a bulk download implements.

description.en: Resource published or curated by a single agent.

usage.en: For DCAT-AP, the class is considered an abstract notion.

description.en: An activity is something that occurs over a period of time and acts upon or with entities; it may include consuming, processing, transforming, modifying, relocating, using, or generating entities.

rawTags.definition-en: An activity is something that occurs over a period of time and acts upon or with entities; it may include consuming, processing, transforming, modifying, relocating, using, or generating entities.

description.en: Any entity carrying out actions with respect to the (Core) entities Catalogue, Datasets, Data Services and Distributions.

usage.en: If the Agent is an organisation, the use of the Organization Ontology14 is recommended.

description.en: rdfs:Literal encoded using the relevant ISO 8601 Date and Time compliant string and typed using the appropriate XML Schema datatype (xsd:gYear, xsd:gYearMonth, xsd:date, or xsd:dateTime).

rawTags.definition-en: rdfs:Literal encoded using the relevant ISO 8601 Date and Time compliant string and typed using the appropriate XML Schema datatype (xsd:gYear, xsd:gYearMonth, xsd:date, or xsd:dateTime).

description.en: decimal represents a subset of the real numbers, which can be represented by decimal numerals. The ·value space· of decimal is the set of numbers that can be obtained by multiplying an integer by a non-positive power of ten, i.e., expressible as i × 10^-n where i and n are integers and n >= 0.

duration represents a duration of time. The ·value space· of duration is a six-dimensional space where the coordinates designate the Gregorian year, month, day, hour, minute, and second components defined in § 5.5.3.2 of [ISO 8601], respectively.

rawTags.definition-en: duration represents a duration of time. The ·value space· of duration is a six-dimensional space where the coordinates designate the Gregorian year, month, day, hour, minute, and second components defined in § 5.5.3.2 of [ISO 8601], respectively.

description.en: Hex-encoded binary data. The ·value space· of hexBinary is the set of finite-length sequences of binary octets.

rawTags.definition-en: Hex-encoded binary data. The ·value space· of hexBinary is the set of finite-length sequences of binary octets.
rawTags.label: xsd:hexBinary

description.en: A temporal entity with zero extent or duration

rawTags.definition-en: A temporal entity with zero extent or duration
